alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 2:22PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Teller and west central El Paso Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 222 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pikes Peak, or 9 miles west of Colorado Springs, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pikes Peak. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft
